How to Run Shaders on Apple Watch OS 3

I’ve wanted to write visualizations for Apple Watch since it was announced. WatchOS 1 & 2 only offered us GIF support - not too much we could do with that. With the introduction of watchOS 3, the Apple Watch hardware is finally starting to become truly accessible to developers - including shaders!

Can the Playgrounds App Unlock Creativity on iPad?

I was sitting beside a toddler on the plane ride to WWDC. He spent the entire flight on an iPad. His main activities were watching Cars and finger painting on some paint app. Good diversions for a long ride, but not the most inspiring use of a young mind’s time. Mobile devices simply don’t faciliate creative output in most cases. Hopefully, Apple’s new Playgrounds app will help blaze that trail in an important context: programming literacy.

Read More

How to Install the new Swift Playgrounds App on your iPad

Apple introduced the new Swift Playgrounds app at WWDC yesterday, which lets you edit playgrounds directly on your iPad. Googling yields tons of posts about its exsitence, but it’s not obvious how developers can actually install it. As it turns out, it’s simple.
